required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Exenatide on 24-Hour Blood Glucose Profile Compared With Placebo in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Exenatide on 24-Hour Blood Glucose Profile Compared With Placebo in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Using Metformin or Metformin Plus a Thiazolidinedione

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to test the hypothesis that in patients with type 2 diabetes, the addition of exenatide will result in lower time-averaged serum glucose during a 24-hour period, compared with placebo.

primary_outcome.measure: Time-averaged serum glucose during a 24-hour period
primary_outcome.time_frame: Every half-hour to hour for 24 hours
primary_outcome.description: Time-averaged serum glucose during a 24-hour period

secondary_outcome.measure: To compare the effects of exenatide and placebo on serum glucose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Each half-hour to 2 hours for 24 hours
secondary_outcome.description: To compare the effects of exenatide and placebo on serum glucose measured as averaged daytime glucose, averaged nighttime glucose, time-averaged postprandial glucose 2 hours after each meal, time-averaged postprandial glucose 4 hours after each meal, 2-hour postprandial glucose averaged across morning and evening meals, and averaged across the three meals, and fluctuation evaluations

arm_group.description: Exenatide and the subject's current oral antidiabetic agent regimen
Placebo and the subject's current oral antidiabetic agent regimen

intervention.description: subcutaneous injection, 5mcg twice a day for one week; then 10 mcg twice a day for one week
subcutaneous injection, equivalent volume to 5 mcg exenatide twice a day for one week; then equivalent volume to 10 mcg exenatide twice a day for one week

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject has an HbA1c between 7.0% and 10.0%, inclusive.
- Subject has a body mass index (BMI) >25 kg/m^2 and <50 kg/m^2.
- Subject is on a stable dose of metformin or metformin plus a thiazolidinedione.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject has been treated with any of the following medications: *exogenous insulin for more than 1 week within 3 months of screening, *sulfonylureas or meglitinides within 2 months of screening, *alpha-glucosidase inhibitors within 2 months of screening, *pramlintide acetate injection within 2 months of screening.
- Subject has received exenatide, GLP-1 analogs, DPP-IV inhibitors, or has participated in this study previously.
